name: vituperatively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves criticizing and attacking someone or something angrily in speech or writing: Government ministers were said to have quarrelled vituperatively over this and other issues. Her first novel is a vituperatively funny attack on business culture.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was screaming vituperatively at him. For years they have disagreed, often vituperatively, on several issues. Why has he been so vituperatively misrepresented?He edited the newspaper, which was vituperatively anti-Federalist, for over twenty years.
